meanings.definition: The quality or state of being effective or capable of producing a desired result.
meanings.sent1: Her electivenesses in problem-solving impressed her boss.
meanings.sent2: The electivenesses of the new marketing strategy led to increased sales.
meanings.sent3: The electivenesses of his magic tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The electivenesses of the medicine cured the patient's illness swiftly.
meanings.sent5: The electivenesses of the sunscreen protected her skin from sunburn.

meanings.definition: The ability to make choices or decisions.
meanings.sent1: Having electivenesses in choosing the right path is important.
meanings.sent2: She valued her electivenesses in selecting her career path.
meanings.sent3: His electivenesses in picking ice cream flavors always made him happy.
meanings.sent4: The electivenesses of the student council determined the theme for the prom.
meanings.sent5: The electivenesses of the chef in creating dishes impressed the customers.

meanings.definition: The power or right to choose or select.
meanings.sent1: The electivenesses of the jury in the trial were crucial.
meanings.sent2: She exercised her electivenesses in choosing the color of the walls.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have electivenesses in selecting its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The electivenesses of the committee members shaped the final decision.
meanings.sent5: His electivenesses in picking the movie for the night made everyone happy.
